page.title: 14"Retirin'": a poem
page.content: {Mary Smith: the village shop closes. (Extracts) It nobbut seems like t'other day But forty years hev passed away Sen we decided to open a shop To sell toffees an chocolates an bottles o pop;..... { (A rates increase, the shop closes.) So we're sorry to put this nooatice up As on New Year's Eve we's be like to shut. It is'nt eawr choice; we think it's a shame; An we'd just hev you know it's t'rate fixers to blame....... { (Villagers must go into the towns to { do their shopping.) It meks it as Weeton will be bowt a shop An to gooa into town on t'bus costs a lot.
